spotInfo.hazards: Shallow areas, swimmers in summer, fishing nets
spotInfo.description: Popular spot on the Hel Peninsula with shallow lagoon and open sea side.
Well-known village spot with strong kitesurfing community and schools.
Famous spit in Puck Bay dividing shallow lagoon from deeper waters.
Small village spot on Hel with shallow, safe lagoon area. There's paid car parking area.

spotInfo.hazards: Port nearby, may be busy in summer
spotInfo.description: Town spot at the bottom of Puck Bay with easy access and small sandy beach.

spotInfo.launch: Sandy Beach on the sea side, concrete and limited launch area on the lagoon
spotInfo.hazards: Crowds in summer, small launch area on the lagoon side, old torpedo tower in the middle of the lagoon
spotInfo.description: Lagoon side for flat water, Baltic side for waves.
Baltic Sea spot with wave riding potential and lagoon on the other side.
Flat water spot on the Vistula Lagoon, quiet and less crowded.
Wave spot on the Baltic coast with the big, wide sandy beach and campsite nearby.
Baltic Sea wave spot, less crowded than Łeba or Jastrzębia Góra.
Challenging wave spot under cliffs, suitable only for experienced kiters.
Wave spot on the east Baltic coast, wide beach but often crowded.
One of the widest beaches in Poland, good for wave riding.

spotInfo.hazards: Variable gusty winds, trees on the shore, narrow entrance to the water, wind shadows in the entrance with eastern winds, rocky bottom on the left from the entrance
spotInfo.description: Large reservoir in Silesia, one of the best kite spots in the southern Poland.

spotInfo.hazards: Trees on shore, gusty wind, wind shadow behind the pier
spotInfo.description: Opole region lake popular with local windsurfers and kiters.

spotInfo.hazards: Mountains cause gusts, small area for the launch, wind shadows during the launch and behind the port, current from the river
spotInfo.description: Mountain river transforming into the lake with gusty but strong wind, used by local kiters. It's possible to kitesurf there with the pure southern winds only (S). Wind blows between the mountains causing Venturi Effect. Therefore wind can be 8-10 knots stronger than the predicted forecast.

spotInfo.hazards: Gusty winds, small launch area, trees near the shore
spotInfo.description: Large lake near Wrocław, popular for water sports.

spotInfo.hazards: Trees on shore, swimmers, gusty winds
spotInfo.description: Lakes in Dąbrowa Górnicza. The best lakes for kiting there are Pogoria III and Pogoria IV.

spotInfo.hazards: Swimmers in summer, gusty wind, trees near the shore.
spotInfo.description: Lake in Silesia with clean water, suitable for local kite sessions.  it's possible to kite there comfortably with the pure western (W) wind only.

spotInfo.hazards: Swimmers in summer, gusty wind, trees near the shore, fishermen, possible issues with the water cleanliness. The best wind is NW, but we can kite with E wind as well, but on the west side of the lake where launch area is very limited and there are hazards like concrete elements in the water
spotInfo.description: Lake near the Gliwice

spotInfo.hazards: Trees near the shore, wind shadows during the entrance, pier, concrete elements
spotInfo.description: Lake near the Rybnik.
Biggest reservoir in central Poland, good winds and large area. Depending on the wind direction, we can choose spots on two sides of the lake - Popów or Zaspy
One of the most famous inland kite spots in Europe with shallow water and reliable wind.
Quiet alternative to Podersdorf with same shallow water conditions.
Flat water paradise in the Curonian Lagoon, very popular in Baltic states.
Inland Czech lake spot, calm and good for practice.
Inland Czech lake spot, calm and good for practice.
World-famous flat water lagoon in Sicily, ideal for freestyle training.
Sardinia’s flat water paradise, reliable mistral wind.
One of the most iconic kite bays in Sardinia with reliable wind.
Kitesurf capital of Europe with powerful Levante and Poniente winds.
Flat water alternative to Tarifa during Levante.
Wave spot near Tarifa, good alternative when Tarifa is too strong.
Huge flat water lagoon, great for freestyle and beginners.
World-class wave spot near Lisbon, powered by strong Nortada winds.
Flat water lagoon north of Lisbon, very good for freestyle.
Strong Nortada wind, excellent wave and freestyle conditions.
Close to Lisbon, long sandy beach with strong Nortada winds.
World-famous surf town with strong wind and wave conditions.
Home of the world’s biggest waves, extreme spot only for experts.
Southern Portugal coast with variety of flat lagoons and wave beaches.
North Sea spot with tides, good waves during storms.
One of Europe’s largest beaches, kiting mecca in Germany.
Germany’s wave capital, hosting world cup windsurf/kitesurf events.
Huge tidal beach, perfect for freeride and buggy/kite landboarding too.
Versatile spot: flat water in fjord, waves on the sea side.
Flat water paradise on the fjord side, perfect for freestyle.
Quiet flat water spot on Ringkøbing Fjord, less crowded than Hvide Sande.
Powerful wave spot on the Danish west coast.
Known as ‘Cold Hawaii’, one of Denmark’s most famous surf towns.
The heart of ‘Cold Hawaii’, world-famous wave riding spot.
World-famous alpine lake spot in Engadin valley with reliable thermal winds.
Beautiful alpine lake spot with reliable thermal winds.
World-class kitesurfing destination with flat lagoon and Atlantic waves.
Red Sea spot with reliable winds and perfect lagoons.
Brazilian hotspot with strong steady trades and both waves and flat lagoons.
Flat lagoon and wave conditions, quiet alternative to Jericoacoara.
Brazil’s flat water paradise, reliable winds and wide lagoon.
Brazil’s best wave spot, consistent wind and reef breaks.
Chilean wave spot with powerful Pacific swell.
One of the longest wave rides in the world, perfect for wave kiting.
Huge bay with steady desert winds, flat water and waves.
One of the most iconic kite spots worldwide, mix of flat lagoon and huge reef waves.
Legendary US spot in Columbia River Gorge, strong thermal winds.
Cape Verde’s Sal island is legendary for wave kiting and freestyle.

spotInfo.hazards: Strong wind, waves on sea side
spotInfo.description: Unique double-side spot on Rhodes: flat lagoon vs waves on sea side.
Southern France spot famous for strong Tramontane wind.
Croatia’s flat water lagoon with reliable afternoon thermals.
Dutch North Sea spot with strong winds and good wave conditions.
The Hague’s beach spot, popular for wave kiting and events.
